Package org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles

Class EIDProfile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.internal.UpgradeableDataHashMap
      • org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles.HardTokenProfile
        • org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles.HardTokenProfileWithPINEnvelope
          • org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles.HardTokenProfileWithVisualLayout
            • org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles.HardTokenProfileWithReceipt
              • org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles.HardTokenProfileWithAdressLabel
                • org.ejbca.core.model.hardtoken.profiles.EIDProfile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, IUpgradeableData, IAdressLabelSettings, IPINEnvelopeSettings, IReceiptSettings, IVisualLayoutSettings
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EnhancedEIDProfile, SwedishEIDProfile, TurkishEIDProfile
    public abstract class EIDProfile
extends HardTokenProfileWithAdressLabel
    EIDProfile is a basic class that should be inherited by all types of eidprofiles in the system.
    Version:
    $Id: EIDProfile.java 22117 2015-10-29 10:53:42Z mikekushner $
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getCertificateProfileId

        public int getCertificateProfileId​(int certusage)
        Indicates which certificate profileid that should be requested when generating certificate of given certusage.
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        The certificate profile id that should be used.

      • getCertWritable

        public boolean getCertWritable​(int certusage)
        Field indicating if a certificate should be set to rewritable on the token.
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the certificate should be rewritabes, if false the certificate is written as read-only and cannot be renewed.

      • getCAId

        public int getCAId​(int certusage)
        Indicates which ca id that should be requested when generating certificate of given certusage. RESERVED FOR FUTURE USE
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        The caid that should be used.

      • getIsKeyRecoverable

        public boolean getIsKeyRecoverable​(int certusage)
        Indicates if a keys used for the given certusage should be saved to database.
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        true if the keys used for the certusage should be saved to database.

      • getReuseOldCertificate

        public boolean getReuseOldCertificate​(int certusage)
        Indicates if the certificate should be reused when recovering a token. This since some application requires the same certificate when decrypting data.
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        true if the certificate should bereused

      • getMinimumKeyLength

        public int getMinimumKeyLength​(int certusage)
        Gives the minimum key length allowed. Generally will the tokens maximum kapacity of key be generated
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        The caid that should be used.

      • getKeyType

        public String getKeyType​(int certusage)
        Indicates which type of key that should be generated for the certusage. RESERVED FOR FUTURE USE
        Parameters:
        certusage - should be one of the CERTUSAGE_ constants.
        Returns:
        The keytype that should be generated, one of the KEYTYPE_ Constants

      • getAllCAIds

        public Collection<Integer> getAllCAIds()
        Returns all valid CAids, if a certusage have CAID_USEUSERDEFINED defined then it will not be among available valus in returned collection.
        Returns:
        IDs

        Help Method that should be used
        Parameters:
        emptyclone - clone

      • reInit

        public abstract void reInit()
        Method used to reinit a hardtoken profile to its default values. Used when changing the profile but want to keep the values that are in common between the two types.
